args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

/-- In a metric space, compactness (every open cover has a finite subcover) implies sequential compactness:
    every sequence has a convergent subsequence. -/
theorem compact_metric_space_sequentially_compact (h : CompactSpace X) :
  ‚àÄ (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï) (hœÜ : StrictMono œÜ) (x : X),
    Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) atTop (ùìù x) := by sorry

variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

/-- In a metric space, compactness (every open cover has a finite subcover) implies sequential compactness:

theorem compact_metric_space_sequentially_compact (h : CompactSpace X) (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X) :

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

/-- In a metric space, compactness (every open cover has a finite subcover) implies sequential compactness:
    every sequence has a convergent subsequence. -/
theorem compact_metric_space_sequentially_compact (h : CompactSpace X) (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X) :
  ‚àÉ (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï) (hœÜ : StrictMono œÜ) (x : X),
    Filter.Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) Filter.atTop (nhds x) := by sorry
